short_summary: The Federal government is seeking tenders for Fishery Officer Dispatch Monitoring Services.
description: Excluding security requirements, the Contract will provide the following Service(s): (1) a Fishery Officer Dispatch Monitoring Service, 24/7 - 365 days a year. This service involves Real-Time monitoring and tracking of 35 Fishery Officers located in the following regions: Province of Ontario, Province of Manitoba, Province of Saskatchewan, Province of Alberta, Northwest Territories, Nunavut.
tags: Notice of Proposed Procurement (NPP) or Request for Tender (RFT)
full_summary:
### Fishery Officer Dispatch Monitoring Services
#### Tender Announcement
___
The Ministère des Pêches et des Océans Canada is issuing a tender for the provision of Fishery Officer Dispatch Monitoring Services. 

#### Key Details
* **Tender Reference:** PW-23-01029831
* **Tender Title (English):** Fishery Officer Dispatch Monitoring Services
* **Tender Title (French):** Service de surveillance de la répartition des agents des pêches
* **Tender Status (English):** This tender has expired.
* **Tender Status (French):** Cet appel d'offres est clos.

#### Contract Information
* **Duration of Contract:** Contract Award Date to March 1, 2024. Renewable for two (2) additional two-year periods (April 1, 2024 to March 31, 2026; and April 1, 2026 to March 31, 2028).
* **Services to be Provided:** 24/7 dispatch monitoring services for up to 35 Fishery Officers located in Ontario, Manitoba, Saskatchewan, Alberta, Northwest Territories, and Nunavut.

#### Security Requirements
* **Security Clearance:** Applicable Security Requirements Checklist and security guide attached as Annex A. 
* **Reliability Status:** Contractor personnel requiring access to Protected information, assets, or sensitive sites must hold a valid Reliability Status.
* **Secure Facilities:** Contractor facilities must not be used for processing, producing, or storing Protected information or assets until approval is received.
* **Document Safeguarding:** Contractor must meet the requirements of the Contract Security Manual (Latest Edition).

#### Subcontracting
* **Security Requirements:** Any subcontracting that involves the handling of Protected information, assets, or sensitive sites must have prior written permission from the Contract Security Program.

#### Contact Information
* **Correspondence Address:** Fisheries and Oceans Canada, 200 Kent St, Station 13E228, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0E6, Canada.
* **Telephone/Email:** Not Applicable. For inquiries, please contact DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca

#### Tender Documents
* **Tender Document URL:** [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2023/03/13/26ab97d34d25f37e2421d3881291e3f6/rfp_30003910_-_fishery_off
